bug.author: tirrorex
bug.description: Could we have a proper documentation (either in the pod files with a custom header) or in the readme? It would help greatly to have the list of available methods and what they do (unless method name is self-explanatory). Having to dig into ~20 objective-c files to get a grasp of what is possible in swift is not equivalent to a proper documentation

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/petewarden>@petewarden</denchmark-link> : Do we have something like this on the cards, or suggestions for contributions?

It goes beyond that. After a close look i now see that your ios framework is in fact a c++ library just wrapped to be downloaded by cocoapods. So it seems we have absolutly no way to use swift with tensorflow except if we wrappe everything ourselves
